attributes.comment:
I think the fees are already so high that I cannot afford to get my daughter's
certificate of citizenship issued in her new name and cannot afford to get my older
daughter's certificate of citizenship issued as she arrived in the US about 10 days
before the Hope for Children Act was effective. One reason international adoptions
are so expensive are the US government fees. To raise fees for citizens
attempting to adopt from other countries is ridiculous - it should not cost over
$400 to get a certificate of citizenship for your child! This will just dissuade people
from completing adoptions in the future as the fees are already completely
inappropriate. To increase them is ridiculous and another example of government
bureaucracy run amok. I think whoever proposed this is the same person that set
the hours of operations for our local BCIS from 9-2 on M-F - I can't type anymore I
am too angry and I think my time will be better spent reviewing who I will vote for
in upcoming elections and protesting these rate increases with my local
government representatives.

Amanda Bosch

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Amanda G. Bosch
